Token.Abstract: Instances of RKManagedObjectImporter perform bulk imports of managed objects into a persistent store from source files (typically in JSON or XML format) using object mappings. The importer provides functionality for updating an existing persistent store or creating a seed database that can be used to bootstrap a new persistent store with an initial data set.
Initializes the receiver with a given managed object model and a path at which a SQLite persistent store should be created to persist imported managed objects.

Parameter.Name: managedObjectModel
Parameter.Abstract: A Core Data manage object model with which to initialize the receiver.

Parameter.Name: storePath
Parameter.Abstract: The path at which to create a SQLite persistent store to persist the imported managed objects.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given managed object model and a complete Core Data persistence stack with a SQLite persistent store at the given store path.

Token.Abstract: Initializes the receiver with a given persistent store in which to persist imported managed objects.

Parameter.Name: persistentStore
Parameter.Abstract: A Core Data persistent store with which to initialize the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given persistent store. The persistent store coordinator and managed object model are determined from the given persistent store and a new managed object context with the private queue concurrency type is constructed.

Token.Abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether existing managed objects in the persistent store should be deleted before import.
A Boolean value indicating whether existing managed objects in the persistent store should be deleted before import.
The persistent store in which imported managed objects will be persisted.
The persistent store in which imported managed objects will be persisted.
The managed object model containing entities that may be imported by the receiver.
The managed object model containing entities that may be imported by the receiver.
A managed object context with the NSPrivateQueueConcurrencyType concurrency type used to perform the import.
A managed object context with the NSPrivateQueueConcurrencyType concurrency type used to perform the import.
A convenience accessor for retrieving the complete filesystem path to the persistent store in which the receiver will persist imported managed objects.
A convenience accessor for retrieving the complete filesystem path to the persistent store in which the receiver will persist imported managed objects.
Imports managed objects from the file or directory at the given path.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to the file or directory you wish to import. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: mapping
Parameter.Abstract: The entity or dynamic mapping you wish to use for importing content at the given path.

Parameter.Name: keyPath
Parameter.Abstract: An optional key path to be evaluated against the results of parsing the content read at the given path. If the mappable content is not contained in a nesting attribute, the key path should be specified as nil.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On input, a pointer to an error object. If an error occurs, this pointer is set to an actual error object containing the error information. You may specify nil for this parameter if you do not want the error information.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A count of the number of managed object imported from the given path or NSNotFound if an error occurred during import.

Token.Abstract: Finishes the import process by saving the managed object context to the persistent store, ensuring all imported managed objects are written to disk.

Parameter.Name: error
Parameter.Abstract: On input, a pointer to an error object. If an error occurs, this pointer is set to an actual error object containing the error information. You may specify nil for this parameter if you do not want the error information.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the save to the persistent store was successful, else NO.

Token.Abstract: Logs information about where on the filesystem to access the SQLite database for the persistent store in which the imported managed objects were persisted.
